text: "And yet that's not a bad thing, in fact it's completely excusable" no it fucking isn't. Shitty poorly thought our writing is a bad thing and isn't excusable. "at the heart of UC3 is a resonant character study, and the subject is Nathan Drake. " and yet, that doesn't excuse how lazy and sloppy every other part of the story is.
author: sunset261

text: how is it underrated if you literally just admitted that it has terrible plot holes? Was Tablot a wizard? What was the point of getting the big sphere to use to make mind-control water if they already had shit to mind control people with? What the hell was there plan to do with it anyway? How could sully tell where Iram is from the star map if he didn't know what time of night it corresponded to? How did the spiders magically get across several continents? shit like this makes the story stupid
author: sunset261

text: All of these things can be explained. When talbot disappears he attaches to a spy rig like mission impossible and they pull him up really quickly. The the stuff they were using was most likely brought back from some previous trip hundreds of years ago to Iram. Maybe it was running out and they needed more and the only way to manufacture it indefinitely was to get the vessel of brass themselves. And Sully was in navy and new how to read the stars so I'm sure anyone who could do that could look at the map on the ceiling and then look at the sky and know which night it would line up. And for the spiders they are basically just there for thrill factor in the game but they could have been brought from Iram (even possibly by Sir Francis Drake after he left) to guard the clues to the lost city.
author: TomOfDaHook17

text:
DON'T YOU EVER COMPARE ME TO ONE OF THOSE THINGS! All Call of Duty fans are mindless, incompetetent dumbasses who think that they're cool because they play a video game with a guy who likes to hold a gun right next to his face! Call of Duty is an abomination to mankind and life! The creators of Call of Duty, their fanbase, and all copies of those games should banished to the deepest reaches of Hell!

On a non rage powered note, I never said it was bad. I just like Uncharted 1 and 3 better.

text: You're right. How dare I complain about how it has plot holes as bad as prometheus does. How dare I complain when it brings up questions only to never fucking answer them. How dare I complain when they remove all replayability from the single-player. How dare I complain when the story and characters are sloppily written. author: Isa the Rebel

text: uncharted 3 = better graphics,better gameplay,better melee combat,better soundtrack,set pieces are more epic and just awesome,most definitely deeper and better multiplayer, both had an amazing story although i find uc3's story more darker and more emotional.Only flaw it's a bit shorter than uc2 and there were a few glitches,problem with uc2 repetitive anoying enemies and Nathan kills to many of them! In the last chapter alone he kills at least 200 soliders! uc3 is better not by much though.
author: JohnnyBoy7267

text: most definitely better than 3 yo. What are you smoking. Uncharted 3 had no Single-player bonuses or medals, making the campaign's replay value pretty much nothing. The story had plot holes you could drive a truck through as was incredibly weak and disjointed. Hell two of the main characters just leave halfway through the game never to be seen again. half of the stuff talbot does is never explained (i.e.being fine after getting shot). The cruise ship sequence didn't move the plot forward at all.

I love the part where Drake is slowly inching his way across that low snowy ledge after he's managed to evade the tank, and then out of nowhere, the giant metal monstrosity comes barreling through and is seen nearly going right off the same cliff that's just overhead of Nathan.

Fantastic chapter in every sense of the word!
